title: Problem with one Google account in Firefox
content: Tengo 6 cuentas de Gmail en Firefox. Todas ellas funcionan correctamente y me puedo loguear en cualquiera de las 6 sin necesidad de poner usuario o pasword, ya que firefox los tiene guardados. Puedo cambiar de una cuenta a otra sin problemas, en una sola ventana de Firefox. Sin embargo, al ir a "contraseñas" en el Menu de Firefox, solo aparecen guardadas 5 de las cuentas. La numero 6, a pesar de funcionar bien, es como si no existiera en ese listado de credenciales guardadas. Ya probé a exportar a otro Firefox en otro PC, y sigue sin aparecer esa cuenta. Necesito recuperar el password de esa cuenta, ya que pertenecía a mi hermano, que falleció hace unos meses, y los mecanismos de recuperación de contraseña de Google no me sirven, ya que no tengo ni el teléfono ni los otros passwords de mi hermano. Mi temor es que si algo le pasa al PC de donde puedo acceder a la cuenta, ya no tenga acceso a los mails, las fotos y todo lo que el tenía en Google Drive. Además, ya que le robaron el teléfono, quiero poder borrar todo lo que tenía en él, y para ello también necesito la contraseña. Agradezco vuestra ayuda.
creator: ha2

creator: matis.kylmamaa

title: Why was RSS support removed from Firefox?
content:
Up until Firefox 64, Firefox had limited support for RSS:

  • Viewing a RSS feed would show you the feed items, with an option to do something with the feed.
  • Live bookmarks would actually subscribe to those feeds

I can understand removing Live Bookmarks. It's a big feature. I don't understand removing the (what I assume to be) XSLT stylesheet that made RSS feeds not look like a wall of XML. Does anybody know what the conversation was here? Are there minutes?

Even basic RSS support helps people interact with the web, and since Chrome and Firefox both dumped RSS, users are being driven further and further into the arms of "Platforms" who handle this stuff through black-box algorithms. And so much tracking.

Mozilla should reverse this one. Bring RSS back hard.
creator: oli9

title: Nem tart megh bizonyos beállításokat a firefox.
content:
Üdv! A problémám a következő: a beállítások>letöltések>alkalmazások résznél már vagy ötször beállítottam minden egyes fájltípusnál (nyilván amiket letöltöttem már), hogy letöltés előtt mindig kérdezzen rá, hogy menteni vagy megnyitni szeretném-e az adott fájlt, adott alkalmazással. A folyamat meg van, nem csinálom rosszul, hisz egy darabig működik minden a megszokott módon, aztán egyszer csak vagy frissítés, vagy szinkronizálás után eldobja az összes itteni beállítást, visszaállítja alaphelyzetbe, illetve törli a már beállított fájltípusokat. Nem jöttem még rá, hogy frissítés vagy szinkronizálás után történik ez, sajnos nem mindig van ezzel időm foglalkozni, de kezd rettenetesen idegesítő lenni a dolog. Kb 2005-2006 óta használom a firefox-ot, még hasonlóval sem találkoztam eddig. Ha akadt is problémám, mindig volt rá megoldás vagy valamiféle kompromisszum pillanatok alatt, de erre nem találok, még akkor sem, ha annyira egyszerű, hogy a szememet kiüti. A problémával 2022. áprilisa óta küzdök (windows 10 (21H2)), most már nagyon nem bánnám, ha lenne rá megoldás! A segítséget előre is köszönöm!

-KJ-

creator: the1reckoner

title: Privacy
content:
You state that Firefox has no back door which allows you or anyone else to track browser user history or browsing information. But is that really true?

First of all, when a user searches using your browser, the search is conducted through Google. Unless one clicks on the button offered by Google to reject normal choices, and specifically opts out of user data sharing with their company, every trace of the user's search will be mined by Google. You should install an override which automatically precludes this step when searching on your browser, and ensure that there is no such sharing or mining.

Second even your company has admitted that you HAVE opened a back door for the NSA and other government agencies to track user information online. That means your browser is no different than any other one; for anyone who knows how to access and redirect this data can continue to do so, just as they would with any other browser.

While I applaud your effort to minimize data sharing on your browser, your publicity appears to be somewhat of a myth, for it bears little relation to reality .

title: Loading previous session on reboot just spawns frozen window since version 100 on Ubuntu.
content:
Hey there,

Since upgrading to Firefox v100 a few weeks ago I've had incessant problems every time I reboot my laptop.

If I leave Firefox running (i.e. I just hit shutdown and let it sort itself out) then next time I boot up, and I try to open Firefox for it to load my prior session, it spawns a new window and just gets stuck forever. If I close Firefox before shutting down, however, it reloads itself just fine.

This has led to several lost sessions and having to restore using sessionstore, either when laptop has died or I've just shut the laptop down without thinking about it.

I run Kubuntu 20.04.

Thanks Chris

title: Pinned Tabs lost (any way around this?)
content:
Hi, is there any fix for the following? The functionality is intentional but it is absolutely maddening, so I'm hoping there is a plugin workaround or something:

> Pinned tabs are bound to a specific window, so make sure to Quit Firefox while this window is still open and do not simply close a window and leave Firefox running with the menu bar visible.

The user should never be in a position where one simple wrong move obliterates things they've saved (even if it is a recoverable situation). To say 'the user must close windows in a certain order else lose all the tabs they clearly don't want to lose' is just bizarre.
